members.member: zone to transfer this portal to

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.CurrentHomeZone
member.summary: Set the current home zone of the portal

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.Radius
member.summary: Retrieve the radius of the portal (calculates if necessary for quad portals) Calculate the local bounding sphere of the portal from the corner points

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.Corners
member.summary: Corners of the portal - coordinates are relative to the sceneNode NOTE: there are 4 corners if the portal is a quad type there are 2 corners if the portal is an AABB type there are 2 corners if the portal is a sphere type (center and point on sphere)

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.LocalCP
member.summary: Local Center point of the portal

member.summary: Derived (world coordinates) direction of the portal NOTE: Only applicable for a Quad portal

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.DerivedSphere
member.summary: Sphere of the portal centered on the derived CP

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.DerivedPlane
member.summary: Derived (world coordinates) Plane of the portal NOTE: Only applicable for a Quad portal

member.summary: Previous frame portal cp (in world coordinates)

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PortalBase.PrevDerivedPlane
member.summary: Previous frame derived plane NOTE: Only applicable for a Quad portal

member.summary: flag indicating whether or not derived values are up-to-date

get the world coordinate aabb of the zone

member.summary: last camera which this zone was visible to

member.summary: list of SceneNodes contained in this particular PCZone

member.summary: flag recording whether any portals in this zone have moved

member.summary: list of Portals which this zone contains (each portal leads to another zone)

member.name: P:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZone.PCZSM
member.summary: pointer to the pcz scene manager that created this zone

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.AddNode(Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZSceneNode)
member.summary: this call adds the given node to either the zone's list of nodes at home in the zone, or to the list of visiting nodes NOTE: The list is decided by the node's homeZone value, so that must be set correctly before calling this function.

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.CheckNodeAgainstPortals(Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZSceneNode,Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.Portal)
member.summary: Recursively check for intersection of the given scene node with zone portals. If the node touches a portal, then the connected zone is assumed to be touched. The zone adds the node to its node list and the node adds the zone to its visiting zone list. NOTE: This function assumes that the home zone of the node is correct. The function "_updateHomeZone" in PCZSceneManager takes care of this and should have been called before this function.

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.CheckLightAgainstPortals(Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZLight,System.UInt64,Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZFrustum,Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.Portal)
member.summary: (recursive) check the given light against all portals in the zone NOTE: This is the default implementation, which doesn't take advantage of any zone-specific optimizations for checking portal visibility

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.UpdatePortalsZoneData
member.summary: Update the zone data for the portals in the zone NOTE: All portal spatial data must be up-to-date before calling this routine.

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.UpdateNodeHomeZone(Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.PCZSceneNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The following function checks if a node has left it's current home zone. This is done by checking each portal in the zone. If the node has crossed the portal, then the current zone is no longer the home zone of the node. The function then recurses into the connected zones. Once a zone is found where the node does NOT cross out through a portal, that zone is the new home zone. NOTE: For this function to work, the node must start out in the proper zone to begin with!/

member.name: M:Axiom.SceneManagers.PortalConnected.DefaultZone.DirtyNodeByMovingPortals
member.summary: Mark nodes dirty base on moving portals.

member.summary: called when the scene manager creates a camera because some zone managers (like TerrainZone) need the camera info.

member.param: The that the Portal is in.
member.returns: true if the Portal is visible.

member.summary: A 'more detailed' check for visibility of an AAB.
member.remarks: This is useful for stuff like Octree leaf culling.
member.returns: None, Partial, or Full for visibility of the box.
